content.label: This game is addicting to play. Offers a variety of cards to choose from to create the perfect strategy

An awesome free-to-play digital ccg which I highly recommend if you're looking for something the likes of MTG. Even though you can gradually earn credits to get all the cards you want, I dropped $20 on this 6 years ago as I saw potential and wanted to support the game. And, although I don't think I've spent but half that since then, I've played it regularly without regrets. The only thing lacking in comparison to some CCGs is more interactive cards (think "instants" or "activated abilities" in response to opponents spells). That said, the game runs a lot more smoothly than it would with these as you don't have to wait for opponent responses to your actions... You just have to wait for them to complete their turn.

title.label: Great game but I got 50 shadow crystals for writing this review

content.label:
Best part about this game is the ridiculous deck diversity. It isn't even that hard to create an original, competitive deck if you know what your doing.

Best card game on the market, and I have played a whole lot, but it payed me to write a five star review, which is bogus because they don't actually know whether you wrote a review, they just send you to the App Store and give you currency. This is good way to generate a lot of positive reviews, so I docked a star because of that.
Decent game, lots of content. Just wish it wasn’t so slow - like playing on card match takes a good 10-15 minutes (at least against the computer). Other than that it’s good!
Addictive! Great variety in strategies, heroes, and cards.
not gonna lie sometimes i stop playing for a couple months but it’s one of those games that you’ll always be drawn too! i’ve been playing since like 2012!

title.label: The previous version was much better

content.label:
Why this dumb campaign mode that focuses solely on having to continually shape your deck in order to beat the AI that you're up against???

I thought the purpose of the game was to experience play with various Heroes and their exclusive cards, while admiring each cards' artwork and gameplay uniqueness.

You have completely negated that with the campaign mode, and instead forced players into frustrating battles, with a mere 50 coin prize, just to have to put towards some card in order to hopefully win the next battle - if all the stars align! At this rate, it'll be a lifetime before I can experience most of what the game has to offer. 

The previous campaign mode was not as challenging, but was much more fun in that it gave players a chance to try out and experience new cards in differing scenarios
Well balance and love their artstyle
Great game
Had it for over 4 years. The game is very deep and tactical. All the new updates have been well developed. Love the new campaign story.

Absolutely wonderful.

Has a lot of the good qualities of magic and other similar games, while feeling unique and interesting. Theory crafting decks is fun, and the new story mode is pretty cool so far too.
Been playing for years and still enjoy the artwork and strategy.
Loving it
Love it

This was my first foray into trading card games. After looking into the options, Hearthstone and Magic were the logical choice given their popularity. But I felt those would be too overwhelming and I would be destroyed. So I tried Shadow Era. So far, it's been reasonably easy to pick up the basics and fun to play. I'd definitely recommend playing this game. Plus, the price is great--FREE. 

A few things I would criticize are the somewhat slow animations, not so intuitive GUI and general lack of guidance. The basics are easy enough though, strategy will take longer. 

I started in the campaign mode versus AI and initially just selected the first hero (Boris). I went through about 7 matches at easy and normal level winning them all. Then I went to the hard level and found it virtually unbeatable. I suspect to beat it I have to accumulate better cards and build more power into my deck. This may be where the fun is for many but for a noob, it can be a source of frustration not realizing you're in an unwinnable position and struggling to just find the right strategy. When the right strategy is to get different cards for your deck. 

Regardless, the game is a lot of fun. I like the graphics. GUI could be improved to remove some clocks and speed up games by a couple minutes (I'm mostly playing on iPhone). Definitely give this game a try.
It's fun
Element and wulven are OP!!!
Very awesome deck game, balanced a bit old but hard die fans still play and keep it active

title.label: Best virtual card game out there.

content.label:
I played Magic the Gathering for years. Then I sold all my cards. I picked this gem up a few years ago and have not put it down. The developers do periodic expansions with a strong effort to balance the game. All this for free. If you want you can pay for bling, but you can get and use all of the cards through play. The clincher for me is meltdown. It is a limited card pool make a deck on the fly format. You open 4 virtual packs and make a deck from what you got.  No game is ever the same. Super replay value with enough players that you never have to wait long.  There are bugs, but also an active community of players weeding them out. Great game. 

One year from my last review.  Still playing this game. It is worth the download.

I've played this game since 2014 and I have to say, this is the best mobile card game I've ever played. It's very fun, in depth, and great for newcomers or experienced players. I do wish you got more 'bang for your buck' when buying crystals, however I can't complain and I enjoy the grind. Fantastic game nonetheless. Keep it up devs!

I got at least one of every card in the game without spending a cent. Of course, you can buy crystals if you want to speed that up. SE is not as deep as Magic, but still fun, and has a good player base and a basic campaign mode. Games are kind of slow-paced though.
Good game.

Pretty fun, it's kinda hard when u start off cuz u have to grind the ai a bit and u don't get crystals a lot unless u watch ads and do surveys or pay real money. Other than that it can be addicting and a lot of fun.

title.label: Most generous free to play..... BS

content.label: This game professes to have the “most generous free to play” I’d have to call BS. Played several hours and only acquired 1 card. There is no diversity in play style, and if you pick the wrong hero deck to start, you end up behind the curve from the get go. There are too many cards to buy with no good filters to find anything you want. Except maybe knowing the exact card name and searching for it.. and boosters are too expensive.. any other game I would have been able to get a few booster or “card draws” by now. I feel as though they talk a mean game about being free to play friendly but it’s a lie. From the get go, you are made to feel like you NEED to spend real money to get anywhere
10/10 more for MTG fans (adults) leave the Blizzard tcg and anime tcg’s for the children. I’ve spent prolly $100 on cards and I’m extremely happy with the cards I have.
One of my favorites. Very balanced, and a lot fun to play.
Goes the distance. Enough content to play for quite a while and without having to pay. Keep up the good work!

Despite forays into Yu-Gi-Oh, Hearthstone, and Magic on my iPad, I always return to Shadow Era. The game is reliably fun, and the card library (and thus deck strategies) are limited enough to be able to easily grasp. It's free to play, and a player starts off with a starter deck and can check in for a free card every day. The new campaign is epic, difficult enough for a good challenge but a quick run through the one-stars is possible depending on the deck vs the challenges. Definitely check the community forum, there's some good strategies on there!
Great game with great potential

title.label: Best mobile tcg out there by far

content.label: I've been a fan since day 1 more than 6 years ago. The slow progress of the game has made it hard on the community but the product is good. Well  balanced and well tested. Hopefully it stays that way for years to come!
Hearthstone became boring so i was looking for similar games and this one just hit home run.

Years ago, this is the game that started me on TCGs. Today I play MTG as well but I enjoy the variety and conciseness that Shadow Era has to offer. With a new development team, I look forward to what the game has to offer in the future. Multiplayer?!?!
g g g g g
Fast passed and fun to play. The mechanics need a little work but I still recommend it.
This game is a top kek
dedicated community and developers
Please add a system for 2v2 or free-for-all!
The mechanics of the game provide some interesting strategic decisions, and I could listen to that battle bgm for hours. Nice work.
Pretty fun game, has occasional lags when facing computer opponents.
As good as Magic

Started when the game was first in beta testing and loved it but it was full of bugs and the meta was down to about 3 heroes. Now I almost feel like I'm starting all over! Love that they have campaign mode, and that it does get harder and harder, but some of the heroes get way too much of a head start... I'm still seeing the occasional bug but this game is even more fun now than it was earlier on. If you like TCG's, this is the game for you!
I have been playing for 6 years now and am still hooked. Great if you enjoy deep strategy.

If youre a fan of Magic the gathering or Hearthstone you will seriously like Shadow Era, been playing the game for several seasons now, game developers always work on new cards and try to keep the heroes well balance. Definitely worth a try.
May mays
Hard to come by compatible cards for your hero but it adds to the fight since you're at a disadvantage. Amazing game none the less
I just wanted the gems but I've been playing for 3 years so it must be good

I have been playing this for years and they continue to update and come up with new challenges.
Definitely worth downloading as the IAPs aren't necessary to win and their are a nearly limitless number of possible card combos to learn and master.
It's ok for killing time
Fun game. Like magic.
This is a pretty great game. Love the artwork and interactive playing field.
